greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of permutations of [n] such that for each cycle c the smallest integer interval containing all elements of c has at most k elements; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: The sequence of column k satisfies a linear recurrence with constant coefficients of order 2^(k-1) for k>0.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..30, flattened
Alice L. L. Gao, Sergey Kitaev, On partially ordered patterns of length 4 and 5 in permutations, arXiv:1903.08946 [math.CO], 2019
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 20 2016
